obfuscation: ﻿`` The new order oof things proposed'': Vision. Reality in Robert Owen 's New Lanark, and New Harmony. The Welsh manufacturer Robert Owen made several community experiments in early nineteenth century.
original: ﻿ "The new order of things proposed": Vision and Reality in Robert Owen's New Lanark and New Harmony. The Welsh manufacturer Robert Owen made several community experiments in the early 19th century.

obfuscation: Two; in them were experiments inside New Lanark, Scotl. also New Harmony, Indiana, inside the U.s. New Lanark was Owen 's first social experiment where he made village with, a cotton mill into sample community.
original: Two of them were the experiments in New Lanark, Scotland, and New Harmony, Indiana, in the U.S.  New Lanark was Owen's first social experiment where he made a village with a cotton mill into a model community.

obfuscation: New Harmony was a later attempt inside Owen to creating a self-contained community. Inside this essay I will present important aspects in these two experiments in order tto compare them.
original: New Harmony was a later attempt of Owen to create a self-contained community. In this essay I will present important aspects of these two experiments in order to compare them.

obfuscation: In early One thous. Eight hundred 's Welshman Robert Owen, who was partner inside a Manchester firm, became manager in the New Lanark mill in Lanarkshire inside Scotland. Owen was confronted with bad living conditions as well as bad conditions of work; in the factory.
original: In the early 1800's the Welshman Robert Owen, who was a partner in a Manchester firm, became a manager of the New Lanark mill in Lanarkshire in Scotland. Owen was confronted with bad living conditions as well as bad working conditions in the factory.

obfuscation: Child labor was very common, theft was extensive, workers had poor housing conditions in squalid surroundings,. There was no education for children. Owen turned limited or below average in number or quantity or magnitude or extent village with the cotton mill as nucleus into a`` program''.
original: Child labour was very common, theft was extensive, the workers had poor housing conditions in squalid surroundings and there was no education for children. Owen immediately turned the little village with the cotton mill as a nucleus into a "welfare program".

obfuscation: Positively, Owen improving many conditions such as the workers ' foods, apparel, houses. The cleanliness in the factory. He prevented by starting to sell alcohol under strict control. Best known is this he started an education for children.
original: Owen improved many conditions such as the workers' food, clothes, houses and the cleanliness in the factory. He prevented drunkenness by starting to sell alcohol under strict control. Best known is that he started an education for children.

obfuscation: Owen agreed that all these improvements, inside New Lanark would promoting the productivity in cotton mill also therefore improvements fostered efficiency at same time as they composed kind inside social reform.
original: Owen agreed that all these improvements in New Lanark would promote the productivity of the cotton mill and thus the improvements fostered efficiency at the same time as they composed a type of social reform.

obfuscation: Naturally improvements inside the community have as a logical consequence expenses but Owen maintained that this would make mill more costeffective. Owen 's key philosophy was that man 's character is formed, inside early childhood, not, by himself, but for him,. Solely, by environment.
original: Naturally the improvements of the community entailed expenses but Owen maintained that this would make the mill more profitable. Owen's main philosophy was that man's character is formed in early childhood, not by himself, but for him, and only by the environment.

obfuscation: To create sound character man should be placed under good influences in early years. Owen further believed that the company had responsibility tto offer good conditions of living. Education, for the persons. By improving many bad conditions in New Lanark he offered the workers a better life.
original: To create a good character man should be placed under good influences in the early years. Owen further believed that society had a responsibility to offer good living conditions and education for the people. By improving many bad conditions in New Lanark he offered the workers a better life.

obfuscation: Owen agreed that he had changed the character, in New Lanark inhabitants by his alterations. The fact is that Owen did not intend, to variance New Lanark mill 's basic character; but he wanted tto create new, better conditions inside mill.
original: Owen agreed that he had changed the character of the New Lanark inhabitants by his alterations. The fact is that Owen didn't intend to change the New Lanark mill's basic character but he wanted to create new, better conditions in the mill.

obfuscation: Children who were brought, up, inside New Lanark were generally healthy,. Respected. Consequently, Mill inside New Lanark was very productive. Obviously, Became also sample community.
original: The children who were brought up in New Lanark were generally healthy and respected. The mill in New Lanark was very productive and became a success and a model community.

obfuscation: New Lanark was consequently mill that Owen turned; into a community, which is inside contrast tto one of his later social experiments, New Harmony, which was rather planned Utopia, to which Owen gathered matter; of people inside order to put his theories, both social. Economy, into practice.
original: New Lanark was consequently a mill that Owen turned into a community, which is in contrast to one of his later social experiments, New Harmony, which was rather a planned Utopia to which Owen gathered a number of people in order to put his theories, both social and economic, into practice.

obfuscation: In this project Owen followed a new economic plan that he emphasised, where the size oof the community was important from point of view oof production. Inside One thous. Eight hundred Twenty Five Owen bought a great piece oof land in Indiana which he renamed New Harmony.
original: In this project Owen followed a new economic plan that he emphasised, where the size of the community was important from the point of view of production. In 1825 Owen bought a great piece of land in Indiana which he renamed New Harmony.

obfuscation: His plan was to creating, a self-contained community, intending this people would be self-supporting, producing they 're own proceeds together with other co-operative villages.
original: His plan was to create a self-contained community, intending that the people would be self-supporting, producing their own products together with other co-operative villages.

obfuscation: Owen believed that there was special question, in persons ( about One thous. Two hundred persons) who could live inside the community inside order tto keep it self-contained. Many activities in community, such as eating also cooking, would be collective.
original: Owen believed that there was a special number of people (about 1200 persons) who could live in the community in order to keep it self-contained. Many activities in the community, such as eating and cooking, would be collective.

obfuscation: Before the the time at which something is supposed to begin Owen invited`` the industrious. Well disposed of all nations'' to come to this community. Be inhabitants. Many oof those who move toward, travel toward something or somebody or approach something or somebody did not turn out tto be as willing to learn as New Lanark inhabitants.
original: Before the start Owen invited "the industrious and well disposed of all nations" to come to this community and be inhabitants. Many of those who came didn't turn out to be as willing to learn as the New Lanark inhabitants.

obfuscation: The community soon ran into difficulties since persons were at odds, about the shape inside governance. The role in religion. New Harmony was consequently failure also did n't last long. Owen withdrew, from the project in One thous. Eight hundred Twenty Eight.
original: The community soon ran into difficulties since people were at odds about the form of government and the role of religion. New Harmony was consequently a failure and didn't last long. Owen withdrew from the project in 1828.

obfuscation: New Harmony was thus intended tto be sample community which could live on its own. Offer work to unemployed. A human being without housing. In this case Owen turned tto more general problems in society. An aspect in this was to cure pauperism also unemployment.
original: New Harmony was thus intended to be a model community which could live on its own and offer work to unemployed and people without housing. In this case Owen turned to more general problems of society. An aspect of this was to cure pauperism and unemployment.

obfuscation: This was in comparison to New Lanark where more specific problems were inside focus, such as improved factory conditions. Both oof the experiments were plans for social reorganisation, later one being based on self-supporting community.
original: This was in comparison to New Lanark where more specific problems were in focus, such as improving factory conditions. However, both of the experiments were plans for social reorganisation, the later one being based on a self-supporting community.

obfuscation: Social aspect was also since Owen 's experiments were focused on lower classes in society. In his later experiment he wanted tto decrease widespread unemployment, by setting up small communities; in New Lanark he improving the conditions for a number in lower-class people.
original: The social aspect was also apparent since Owen's experiments were focused on the lower classes of society. In his later experiment he wanted to decrease the widespread unemployment by setting up small communities; in New Lanark he improved the conditions for a number of lower-class people.

obfuscation: Even if it was clear this Owen was concerned with economic aspects oof his communities he still had oof mind this dude should have good living terms. He believed that had responsibility to offer such conditions tto the people.
original: Even if it was obvious that Owen was concerned with the economic aspects of his communities he always had in mind that man should have good living conditions. He believed that society had the responsibility to offer these conditions to the people.

obfuscation: Since plant 's dominant parting in man 's life it must be, as good as possible so he can live, inside it, Owen maintained. His purpose in his experiments was upon the community also n't on the individual.
original: Since the factory is the dominant part in man's life it must be as good as possible so he can live in it, Owen maintained. However, his purpose of his experiments was upon the community and not on the individual.

obfuscation: Owen 's key philosophy, this dude is trained, by environmental also that he should be placed under a good influence, was something that he based all his work, on. This was also something that Owen in fact attempted tto carry, into effect by his social experiments.
original: Owen's main philosophy, that man is formed by the environment and that he should be placed under a good influence, was something that he based all his work on. This was also something that Owen indeed tried to carry into effect by his social experiments.

obfuscation: Happiness was keyword for Owen 's work:`` The object in all human use of physical or mental energy; hard work is to be happy. Happiness can not be attained, enjoyed also secured, unless all men possess health, real knowledge also wealth.'' One Owen experiments had pragmatic way inside working.
original: Happiness was a keyword for Owen's work: "The object of all human exertions is to be happy. Happiness cannot be attained, enjoyed and secured, unless all men possess health, real knowledge and wealth." 1 Owen experiments had a pragmatic way of working.

obfuscation: He tried to form a light queue that is used in lettering to help align the letters or propose reforms that would creating; a new social environment for lower catagory people. The fact is that his first attempt was success while New Harmony did not work inside practices. One Letter from Robert Owen to London Newspapers, August Seven, One thous. Eight hundred Seventeen
original: He tried to form guidelines or propose reforms that would create a new social environment for lower class people. The fact is that his first attempt was a success while New Harmony didn't work in practice. 1 Letter from Robert Owen to London Newspapers, August 7, 1817
